result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas Aaron Krueger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any other sentence. Credit for 65 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.
Court directs the Clerk of Courts Office to notify the Department of Motor Vehicles that  ZERO DAYS (0 days) REVOCATION should be imposed in this case
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment. Random urine screens/Attend NA.
No contact with the victim  A.K.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 9-24-18; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 9-24-18; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Thomas Aaron Krueger not in court.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Surety present in court.
  
Bail Forfeiture Hearing proceeded.  Statements to the Court.
Court GRANTS Surety's request for return of bail. 
Clerk:  jms
Case is scheduled for BAIL/BOND FORFEITURE HEARING ON 12-19-2014 at 9:00 a.m. before Judge Jeffrey Kremers. Notices mailed to defendant and surety.
Notice of bail/bond forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($500.00) ad

Defendant Thomas Aaron Krueger in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Thomas Aaron Krueger in custody.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for FOUR YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of ONE YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of THREE YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 65 days.

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 9-24-2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 9-24-2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Random urine screens/Attend NA
-No contact with the victim  A.K. 


Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he/she may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Attorney Anne A. Devitt in court, defendant Thomas Aaron Krueger not in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. On motion of the State, Court set bail in the amount of $2500.00 cash with TOT to Justice point for monitoring.
